fields.description:
h3. Summary
IE fails to upload too many attachments when you use drag and drop


h3. Environment
- Confluence
- IE Browser


h3. Steps to Reproduce
There are multiple ways to reproduce the issue. I will list 2 tests:

h5. Test #1
The first test was done with the following steps:
# Create a new Confluence Page
# Drag and Drop images directly into the page (I uploaded 300 images)
# All images are uploaded successfully
# On IE I saw some images towards the end with the thumbnail not showing

This error appears in the logs which indicates that there was a race condition on the temp directory to fetch the thumbnail of that image:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-12-13 09:44:48,850 ERROR [http-nio-exec-123] [persistence.dao.filesystem.FileSystemAttachmentDataUtil] failedToWriteTempF
ile Error writing '/path/to/home/directory/attachments/ver003/92/19/250019842/226/193/3111111/12345678/data112132131242352312.tmp' to disk.
– url: /confluence/plugins/drag-and-drop/upload.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8090/confluence/pages/editpage.action?pageId=123456789 | action: upload
java.io.IOException: Socket read failed
{code}


h5. Test #2
# Open the *Insert Files and Images* popup
# Drag & Drop the images (300 images)
# The browser will hang
# When using a reverse proxy, the access log show that the drag and drop POST action was rejected by the server with HTTP Error 400 (BAD REQUEST)
# Investigating this, Confluence uses AJAX requests for this POST action. IE has a limitation on the length of the URL, so at some point IE is trimming the URL sent with the POST request, causing the request to be rejected by the server


h3. Expected Results
No errors happening during the upload and all images thumbnails are displayed properly.


h3. Actual Results
Actual results described above based on each test 

h3.Workaround
There are 2 workarounds here:

h5. Workaround 1
Those problems do not appear on Chrome and Firefox

h5. Workaround 2
# Open the Attachments menu of this page
# Drag and Drop the images there
# This request is faster than all the other tests
# All of the images are successfully uploaded without a problem
# No browser hanging and no errors

*Reasons behind this:*
In Test #1, every image upload consists of the following requests:
- POST to upload the image
- GET to fetch the thumbnail of the uploaded image

In the above test, every image upload consists of only the following request:
- POST to upload the image
fields.summary: IE fails to upload too many attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you delete a page with multiple versions, you can still view the previous versions of the page if you have the direct URL stored somewhere.

This is undesirable because a deleted page should not be viewable unless you restore it from the trash.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space.
# Create a new page called "Test page" with no content.
# Edit the page again and add any content to create Version 2 of "Test page". Save it.
# Edit the page again and add any content to create Version 3 of "Test page". Save it.
# Go to {{...}} > Page History.
# Click to view version 2 of the page and store this URL somewhere else or keep the tab open.
# Navigate back to the latest version of "Test page" and delete the page.
# Go back to the tab or URL of version 2 of the page.

h3. Expected Results
The URL should be inaccessible and it should tell the user that this page has already been deleted.

h3. Actual Results
The user can view the page successfully.

h3. Workaround
Purge the page from the trash via the Space Tools.
fields.summary: A deleted page's past versions can still be viewed via direct URL

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45561].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

We have a great feature to [comment on a file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/share-and-comment-on-files-724765118.html#ShareandCommentonFiles-Commentonafile] (Comment on File also known as "pinned comments"; name it COF here).
However to see COF, now Confluence users have to go to each comment pages.
In other words, Confluence users cannot see COFs all at once.


h3. Suggested Solution

Like as ["View tasks" in profile page for @mention|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-assign-and-view-tasks-724764949.html#Add,Assign,andViewTasks-Viewtasks], Providing report section which shows such as following fields can solve the problem. Or listing by CQL query also seems good.

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/files/724764949/724764952/1/1427771651887/TaskProfileIncomplete.png!
cf. [Task Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/task-report-macro-724765319.html]


Fields:
* List the all COFs
* List the commented files
* List the count of COF by each files
* List the resolution statuses of COFs



 
h3. Workaround

Nothing in particular.
fields.summary: Need a way to list Comment on Files altogether

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The instance health plugin adds a check for the presence of {{confluence-healthcheck-eol.json}} in your Confluence home directory to check EOL date. If that file is not present on the system and the system cannot reach the marketplace to check EOL the health check plugin will not run and will throw an error of 'there was an error performing the instance health check' in the GUI.

!health_error.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the latest Confluence instance health plugin (2.1.7)
# Check that {{confluence-healthcheck-eol.json}} does not exist in {{$CONFLUENCE_HOME}}
# Remove the ability of the system to connect to the marketplace
#  Check the instance health tab in Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The check does not fail if the file does not exist, as the data is persisted somewhere else (e.g.: in the database) or the file is recreated automatically.

h3. Actual Results

The error "Unable to verify the End of Life date for version '5.8'. The check has not been performed." is returned, instead of performing the health check. An exception such as the below will appear in the logs:

{noformat}
2016-12-20 10:56:47,436 ERROR [SupportHealthCheckThread-5] [plugins.healthcheck.eol.EolSupportHealthCheck] check An error occurred when performing the EOL check, see the exceptions for more info
        java.net.UnknownHostException: marketplace.atlassian.com: nodename nor servname provided, or not known
        	at java.net.Inet6AddressImpl.lookupAllHostAddr(Native Method)
        	at java.net.InetAddress$2.lookupAllHostAddr(InetAddress.java:928)
        	at java.net.InetAddress.getAddressesFromNameService(InetAddress.java:1323)
        	at java.net.InetAddress.getAllByName0(InetAddress.java:1276)
        	at java.net.InetAddress.getAllByName(InetAddress.java:1192)
        	at java.net.InetAddress.getAllByName(InetAddress.java:1126)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.SystemDefaultDnsResolver.resolve(SystemDefaultDnsResolver.java:45)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.connect(DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.java:111)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.connect(PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.java:353)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.establishRoute(MainClientExec.java:380)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.execute(MainClientExec.java:236)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.ProtocolExec.execute(ProtocolExec.java:184)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RetryExec.execute(RetryExec.java:88)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:110)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:184)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:82)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:107)
        	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:55)
        	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.healthcheck.util.SupportEolCheckUtil.makeRequestToMarketplace(SupportEolCheckUtil.java:174)
        	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.healthcheck.util.SupportEolCheckUtil.getLatestConfluenceVersionName(SupportEolCheckUtil.java:148)
        	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.healthcheck.util.SupportEolCheckUtil.getVersionFromMarketplace(SupportEolCheckUtil.java:50)
        	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.healthcheck.eol.EolSupportHealthCheck.getVersionFromMarketplace(EolSupportHealthCheck.java:158)
        	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.healthcheck.eol.EolSupportHealthCheck.check(EolSupportHealthCheck.java:93)
        	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.check(PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.java:41)
        	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.concurrent.SupportHealthCheckTask.run(SupportHealthCheckTask.java:33)
        	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.concurrent.SupportHealthCheckProcess.run(SupportHealthCheckProcess.java:43)
        	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckProcessCallable.call(HealthCheckProcessCallable.java:44)
        	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckProcessCallable.call(HealthCheckProcessCallable.java:20)
        	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Download the attached [^confluence-healthcheck-eol.json] and put it in your {{$CONFLUENCE_HOME}} directory.

h3. Notes

Previously the EOL check did not take into account proxies when trying to establish a connection to the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com]. However as of CONF-45506 this is fixed in Confluence Instance Health 2.1.10. There is an upgrade task that will create the file if it doesn't exist, however if the file is deleted or removed somehow (say deleted in a migration) the file is not created again.


Lastly, note from screenshot that the Health Check UI reports a green tick for the End of Life Check.  That means "The health check has passed successfully. No action is required."  This is incorrect/misleading.
fields.summary: EOL check causes health check to be unable to lookup the version when marketplace is not available and the json file is deleted

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary

When Confluence's server.xml is configured to run over SSL, the healthcheck URL continues to use the HTTP protocol to reach synchrony-proxy, which causes a failure as the request should be over HTTPS.
h2. Steps to reproduce

Install Confluence 6.0.2 to run over SSL (e.g. port 8443) at the Tomcat level (no external proxy involved). Self-signed cert is ok as long as it is imported into the Java trust store that Confluence is using.

After startup, observe the following repeated in logs:
{code:java}
2016-12-13 17:28:52,918 WARN [synchrony-interop-executor:thread-1] [plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProxyMonitor] pollHealthcheck Could not ping the synchrony-proxy [http://localhost:8443/synchrony-proxy/healthcheck]: 
org.apache.http.NoHttpResponseException: The target server failed to respond
{code}
Healthcheck URL should be [https://localhost:8443/synchrony-proxy/healthcheck] (HTTPS) rather than plain HTTP.
h2. Workaround
 1. Enable the standard HTTP connector port in the {{server.xml}} file, for example:
{code:java}
<Connector port="8090" connectionTimeout="20000" redirectPort="8443"
                maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
                enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" debug="0" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
                protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"/>
{code}

 2. Disable the healthcheck request by setting a system property *synchrony.proxy.healthcheck.disabled* to true (in setenv.sh or setenv.bat) in Confluence 6.1.0 (when it's released). For example:
{code:java}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Dsynchrony.proxy.healthcheck.disabled=true ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}

If you are running Confluence as a Windows Service, access the [Java Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-set-system-properties-for-confluence-running-as-a-service-on-windows-873858384.html] and add this line:

{code}
-Dsynchrony.proxy.healthcheck.disabled=true
{code}

The 1st workaround is already included in our documentation as below:
 - [Troubleshooting collaborative editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+Collaborative+Editing]
 - [Running Confluence Over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Running+Confluence+Over+SSL+or+HTTPS]

The 2nd workaround will be added in the same documentation when 6.1 is released. This ticket will now be resolved since the workarounds have been provided.
fields.summary: Confluence incorrectly using HTTP protocol to reach synchrony-proxy during healthcheck when running over SSL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Concurrent editing does not work properly when the page has the *Status* macro inside the *Tip* macro or the *JIRA* macro inside *Expand*. It all indicates that it is related to nesting macros on the same page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence lower than version 6 (the Collaborative Editing feature must not exist yet).
# Create a page adding a *Tip* macro
# Inside the *Tip* macro add a *Status* Macro
# Add 2 lines of comments below and outside the *Tip* macro
# Now open the same page in another browser
# In both browsers make sure that you're seeing the same content, then click on *Edit* in each browser
# In one of the browsers, change the first line of comment you've added below the *Tip* macro to some other text and save it.
# In the other browser, edit the second line changing the text so something else and save.

h3. Expected Results
* The changes will be saved merging it accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
* The page offers to overwrite the changes, reverting the changes that the other browser has done.
 
h3. Notes
(!) This issue *does not* happen if we remove the *Status* macro from inside the *Tip* macro. It also does not occur if you remove the *JIRA* macro from inside *Expand*.

h3.Workaround
# Remove the *Status* macro from inside the *Tip* macro (avoid nesting macros on a page).
# Upgrade to Confluence 6 in order to use the Collaborative Editing feature.
fields.summary: Concurrent Editing Breaks With Nested Macros on a Page

  {panel}

h3. Problem statement
The 'Notify Watchers' checkbox on pages are cleared and set back to default once the user clears their browser cache. This is not ideal because some users clear their browser cache often and the checkbox for all pages will then set to default.

h3. Solution
Store the setting per user and per page in the database so the setting will remain even when the user's browser cache is cleared.

h3. Workaround
Use [Javascript to disable checkbox|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-uncheck-notify-watchers-check-box-on-confluence-editor-by-default-314449908.html]
fields.summary: Store the 'Notify Watchers' setting for each user and page in the database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45534].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The current implementation of *DEBUG* (or *ALL*) level is set to the class *{{com.atlassian.confluence.mail}}* doesn't log any helpful information for troubleshooting purposes or simple consulting of emails sent by Confluence.
 Here is an example of the logged message when a page is created in a space where the user is a watcher:

 
{code:java}
2016-12-08 11:03:45,957 DEBUG [NotificationSender:thread-2] [confluence.mail.embed.ThreadLocalMimeBodyPartRecorder] record Recorded DataSources with names [page-icon,com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-email-resources_view-page-email-adg-footer-item_icon,com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-email-resources_add-comment-to-content-email-adg-footer-item_icon,com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-like_view-email-adg-content-item_icon,avatar_909dc5ca9d66d2392b9d7bb6d625385f,footer-desktop-logo,footer-mobile-logo].
 2016-12-08 11:03:46,000 DEBUG [NotificationSender:thread-2] [atlassian.confluence.mail.BotocssMailContentProcessor] process Botocss is about to inject styles in to the email.
 2016-12-08 11:03:46,041 DEBUG [NotificationSender:thread-2] [atlassian.confluence.mail.BotocssMailContentProcessor] apply Pruning selected styles from the email.

{code}
If the user is mentioned or other notifications event is triggered and the email is sent successfully, the same messages are logged. This is very confusing for troubleshooting purposes since we cannot determine the action that triggered the email nor the users involved.
h3. Suggested Solution

The mail logging system could be implemented as it currently is in JIRA. After enabling the *DEBUG* level to the *atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log*, this is an example of the logged message after the email is sent:

 
{code:java}
2016-12-09 18:40:00,457 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='usermail' Subject='(JEP-3) test' From='null' FromName='System Administrator (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@1625fac' MessageId='null' ExcludeSubjectPrefix=false' anonymous Mail Queue Service Message was sent with Message-Id <JIRA.10012.1479403314000.1.1481316000418@Atlassian.JIRA>

{code}
h3. Why this is important

This is important for both the customers and the support service to troubleshooting the email system.
h3. Workaround 

There is no known workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: As an Administrator I want more information to be logged when DEBUG level is set for email class

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45525].
  {panel}

Before Confluence 5.0, hitting "C" to create opened up a modal dialog which allowed the user to select which template to use for the new page.

Now, when the user hits "C" they are immediately delivered to a new, blank, template-less page.

This functionally ruins the "c" shortcut for most people since I've personally never met a Confluence user who routinely created new blank pages, and most Confluence shops I've seen are very opinionated about standardization of documentation through templates. 

Please return the functionality of "c" back to it's pre5.0 state where it was very useful! (Or add a Preference that lets me decide, on the off-chance that there is one weird confluence user out there who hates templates and conformity and rolls new blank documents every day!) 

(Powered by [Atlassian Confluence|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence] 5.10.6)
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut: clicking 'c' to create should bring up 'create from template' dialog not a blank new page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45519].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When adding a Table Of Contents macro in a Child Display macro (with rich content selected) on a parent page, the sub headers from the Table of Contents on the child page do not work. On the parent page, when you click on a header option from the child page, the header name is merely appended to the parent page's URL. This is because the TOC macro uses anchors and appends them to the current page's URL. 
h3. Suggested Solution
There are two options:
# Add additional functionality to the Child Display macro to have it handle the child page URL with the header.
# Update the way the TOC macro works to include the full URL of the page with the header.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro should work in Child Display macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45518].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In some situations, it would be useful to choose between OR/AND condition when filtering tasks by label in the Task Report Macro. For example, if the user wants to pull only tasks that have two specific labels at the same time, not one OR another, it would be useful to have this option.
h3. Suggested Solution

Insert a check box in the Task Report Macro configuration with the option to use AND condition instead of OR.
h3. Why this is important

Right now, if the user wants to pull only tasks that share more than one label, they need to create another one just to reflect that condition. If you are working with a large set of tasks, this could become practically impossible.
 
h3. Workaround 

Add another label to the tasks to indicate that they should be pulled from the Task Report Macro.
fields.summary: Option to use AND condition between the labels in Task Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45516].
  {panel}

Under page we have 3 options today: Copy, Move and Delete.

I'd like to suggest a 4th option to deal with wiki pages - Archive.

 Essentially, that action would *move* that page under let's say 'Archive' page within the same space thus keeping all of the obsolete/old wiki pages in one place.

Additionally, you could assign 'archived' or 'archive' tags for easier search-ability.

My suggestion is similar to what you already have with 'how-to articles'.

 

Regards,

 

Andrei Tokarev
fields.summary: Archive option under page options

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing an XML Backup from Cloud to Server on Oracle 12c, the process fails.


h3. Environment
Oracle 12c with ojdbc6 and ojdbc7 driver
Oracle 12c  12.1.0.2.0 with ojdbc8 driver


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export an XML Backup from Cloud
# Modify the {{pdata}} file in the XML Backup (details here [CONF-28272|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28272])

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45513].
  {panel}

*Use case:*

We allow some external users to access our internal company Confluence. This is done using a LDAP user directory, so new external users are synchronized automatically when they have a special Confluence right. Sometimes we don't grant access to any space but plan to do so later. So some users have access to our Confluence but shouldn't have access to any Space. But if they login, the Welcome screen forces users to watch a Space. It seems to be if they aren't allowed to see any Space, the Welcome screen chooses a random Space for suggestion. The user can't skip the process, so he watches the space he shouldn't be able to see. From now on he can see the space but isn't listed in the permission setting for that Space. So one can't also detect or remove the permission.

 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Have the Welcome screen enabled (for all modules)
 * Add fresh user to Confluence
 * Assign the user to a group without default space permissions (global permissions "can use", but not listed under default space permissions)
 * Login as that user
 * Skip intro
 * Skip also next page (thats the personal space page setup? not sure but also not important for this)
 * Check the suggested Space for watching
 * Open that space

 

*Actual result:*
 * User can see a space
 * User is not listed when checking the space permissions

 

*Expected result:*
 * 3rd welcome screen is skipped because he can't watch any space
 * User can't see any space

 

We had this issue multiple times, I can not guarantee that users see what they are meant to see.

 

*Workaround for +future situations+:*
 * Skip welcome screen ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-skip-the-welcome-action-for-new-users-in-confluence-777016501.html)]

 

*Workaround for +past situations:+*
 * ???

 

I need something like:
 * Find out which users can see spaces they shouldn't see
 * Remove their access to those spaces

Our Confluence version is 5.9.8.
fields.summary: Welcome screen for users without any permissions grants access to random space

h3. Summary

In JIRA if you right click -> "Open image in new tab" on an attachment, the image will load. If you wait ~10 minutes and refresh the page or send the link to another user, they will receive an error about the Token being expired and verification failing.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.610.2 - Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue with an image attachment
 # Right click image and select "Open image in new tab"
 # Wait 10 minutes
 # Refresh page

h3. Expected Results
 * Image attachment shows up - extend token up to an hour at least

h3. Actual Results

Receive the following error:
{code:java}
{"error":{"code":"UnauthorizedError","title":"Token verification failed: jwt expired","href":"https://media-api.atlassian.io#UnauthorizedError"}}

{code}
h3. Notes

If you just view the image attachments within JIRA there's no timeout issue.
h3. Workaround
 * View image attachment in JIRA directly

fields.description:
Note : This is a bug cloned from [JRA-61781|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61781]

Health Check Results :
{code}
Name: End Of Life
Is healthy: false
Failure reason: TimeoutException after 20000ms
Severity: UNDEFINED
{code}

Looking at the logs, you should expect the following error while Confluence is running EOL Health Check :
{code}
2016-11-10 10:01:17,231 ERROR [SupportHealthCheckThread-8] [plugins.healthcheck.eol.EolSupportHealthCheck] check An error occurred when performing the EOL check, see the exceptions for more info
org.apache.http.conn.ConnectTimeoutException: Connect to marketplace.atlassian.com:443 [marketplace.atlassian.com/131.103.28.7] failed: Connection timed out
	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.connect(DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.java:149)
	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.connect(PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.java:353)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MinimalClientExec.execute(MinimalClientExec.java:183)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.MinimalHttpClient.doExecute(MinimalHttpClient.java:107)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:82)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.healthcheck.util.SupportEolCheckUtil.makeRequestToMarketplace
{code}

h5. Workaround
Create <CONFLUENCE_HOME>/shared-home/confluence-healthcheck-eol.json with example content. This file is located in the {{/var/atlassian/application-data/shared-home}} folder by default on a linux system.
{code}
{"versions":[{"name":"5.9","releaseDate":"2015-11-24"},{"name":"5.10","releaseDate":"2016-06-09"},{"name":"6.8","releaseDate":"2018-03-19"},{"name":"6.9","releaseDate":"2018-05-07"},{"name":"6.10","releaseDate":"2018-06-25"},{"name":"6.0","releaseDate":"2016-10-31"},{"name":"6.1","releaseDate":"2017-03-16"},{"name":"6.2","releaseDate":"2017-05-12"},{"name":"6.3","releaseDate":"2017-07-06"},{"name":"6.4","releaseDate":"2017-09-05"},{"name":"6.5","releaseDate":"2017-11-01"},{"name":"6.6","releaseDate":"2017-12-11"},{"name":"5.8","releaseDate":"2015-06-02"},{"name":"6.7","releaseDate":"2018-01-29"}]}
{code}

h5. Notes
The issue also seems to be happening on environment that utilize outbound proxy, whereby, even configuration are done correctly (adding marketplace to the non proxy host config), and connection towards Marketplace is possible (add-ons and UPM works fine), the healthcheck plugin still throws Connect to marketplace.atlassian.com:443 [marketplace.atlassian.com/131.103.28.7] failed: Connection timed out

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Confluence 5.8, it is reporting a warning for End of Life date approaching without the number of days in the error string.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start up Confluence 5.8.
# Install the latest STP / Confluence Instance Health

h3. Expected Results

The below error is produced:

{quote}
Confluence version 5.8 is approaching End of Life. Please plan to upgrade Confluence within <number of days before End of Life date> days.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results

{quote}
Confluence version 5.8 is approaching End of Life. Please plan to upgrade Confluence within \{1\} days.
{quote}

h3. Notes

This is a correct warning as 5.8 [End of Life|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings#AtlassianSupportOfferings-EndofLifePolicy] is approaching, however the number of days is not added to the translated String so it reports it as {1}.

h3. Resolution

Update Confluence Instance Health to 2.1.9 or later.
fields.summary: Confluence Health Check Plugin is reporting any 5.8 version is approaching End of Life.  Please plan to upgrade Confluence within {1} days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45483].
  {panel}

Your documentation is full of marketing garbage. It thinks it's being friendly but when you use too many words and sell me on something I'm already using, that's not friendly. It's annoying. Plus, it takes forever to get the answers I'm looking for because they are not the primary purpose of the writing. 

Here's an example from your Pages and Blogs documentation. I went there when I was looking for how to create a page that hangs off a main page. Pages and Blogs sounded like a reasonable place to start. Here's what I got:
"When you create any content in Confluence - whether it's taking down some quick [notes from a meeting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/meeting-notes-blueprint-329975386.html], writing a [requirements page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/product-requirements-blueprint-329975392.html], or letting your teammates know about the company's latest marketing push - you'll either be creating it as a [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-and-edit-pages-139476.html] or a [blog post|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blog-posts-834222533.html]. You may be shocked to know that this page you're reading now, is, in fact, a Confluence page!

Pages and blog posts are the two things that allow you to capture and share information in Confluence, and which one you use depends on what you want to do with your content. If you want the information to last, and possibly evolve over time, then you likely want to create a page; if the information is specific mainly to the current time-frame, and isn't going to change over time, then you'll most likely want to create it as a blog post. These aren't hard-and-fast rules; they're just pointers to give you a place to start."

Here's a rewrite that's actually aimed at people who are looking for answers, not friends or marketing garbage. 

 

"When you create any content in Confluence you are creating a [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-and-edit-pages-139476.html] or a [blog post|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blog-posts-834222533.html].  For instance, the page you're reading now is a Confluence page.

Create a page when you want the information to last, and possibly evolve over time.

Create a blog post if the information is time-specific and will not change over time.

These aren't hard-and-fast rules; they're just pointers to give you a place to start."

 

See how I did that? I put the answers right where everyone can see them instead of burying it in a torrent of bullshit. Oops! Can I say bullshit?

I just did!

Carl Yorke

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45468].
  {panel}

Confluence opens the port 5701 for the cluster collaborative editing even when we start a standalone Confluence.

The port is specified here on the [data center system properties documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-synchrony-for-data-center-858772125.html], however there is no mention of the port 5701 in the [Confluence system properties here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] I was able to test this locally and Confluence is starting the port 5701, which is supposed to be from data center even when I'm using a standalone instance type.

We should disable this port when not using a data center version or at least provide an option to manually disable it.

h3. Environment 
Confluence 6.0.1 and 6.0.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45467].
  {panel}

h3. Description

Some video format is working in specific browser but is not working in other browsers. For example, .avi video does not work in Chrome, IE11, and FireFox, .mov only working fine in Chrome and FireFox, and .mpeg video only working in Safari.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a page
 # Upload videos with .avi, .mov, .mpeg and .swf
 # Use multimedia macro to add the video in the page
 # Save the page
 # Access the page with FireFox, Chrome, and IE

*Expected Result*
Video render correctly and able to play it without error

fields.description:
h5. Summary
The new application links plugin only supports OAuth for authentication. Due to this, we cannot create a true uni-directional application link.

h5. Environment
* Confluence 5.10
* Application Links plugin 6.0+

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create the link from the source instance
* Under the *Connections* section, set both Local Authentication values for Outgoing and Incoming to *Disabled*.  
* In the target instance, edit the link and set incoming authentication to OAuth. The outgoing authentication should be disabled for all authentication types.

h5. Expected Results
When creating an application link in one direction, it should display as correctly configured in the application links status page.

h5. Actual Results
Although this can be configured, we see a network error in the applink status

h5. Workaround 1 
* Create the link from the source instance
* Under the *Connections* section, both Local Authentication values for Outgoing and Incoming to *Disabled*.  
* In the target instance, edit the link and set incoming authentication to OAuth. The outgoing authentication should be disabled for all authentication types.

The application link status will still show a network error, but the application link will work in one direction from the source instance to the target instance.

h5. Workaround 2
Shutdown Confluence and backup your database before making any of these changes. We recommend trying out these changes only in a test environment.
# Go to Confluence and JIRA and remove all existing applinks 
# Shutdown Confluence
# Backup the {{confluence_install/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins}} folder
# Follow our guide on [how to Remove Bundled or System Plugins|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-remove-bundled-or-system-plugins-648544751.html] to remove the following JAR files from the {{confluence_install/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins}} folder
#* applinks-basicauth-plugin-5.2.2.jar  
#* applinks-oauth-plugin-5.2.2.jar  
#* applinks-trustedapps-plugin-5.2.2.jar
#* applinks-cors-plugin-5.2.2.jar	     
#* applinks-plugin-5.2.2.jar
# Download the following files attached to this ticket:
#* [^applinks-basicauth-plugin-5.0.4.jar] 
#* [^applinks-oauth-plugin-5.0.4.jar] 
#* [^applinks-trustedapps-plugin-5.0.4.jar]
#* [^applinks-cors-plugin-5.0.4.jar]	     
#* [^applinks-plugin-5.0.4.jar]
# [Clear the plugin cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+clear+Confluence+plugins+cache]
# Start Confluence 

h5. Notes
Uni-directional links are useful when one of the applications is in a DMZ or has no internet access. In the case of one of our customers, they are connecting a Confluence instance that does not have internet/external network access to a 2nd Confluence site and using a plugin to publish to the second instance.
fields.summary: Support for uni-directional application links
Adoply Web App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you re-install a plugin in one node while the plugin is disabled, it will cause an inconsistent state in the UPM where one node has the plugin enabled and the other node does not.

h3. Environment
Confluence Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download a copy of the .OBR for the latest Gliffy release. (I am using Gliffy as an example, but this seems to happen with any plugin.)
# On node 1, use the UPM to upload the Gliffy OBR.
# On both node 1 and node 2, reload pages to verify that Gliffy is installed. (For example, you should see 3-4 sidebar items in each nodes' admin pages that link to Gliffy pages.)
# On node 1, use the UPM to disable the Gliffy plugin.
# On nodes 1 and 2, refresh the pages and note that the Gliffy links do not appear on any node.
# On node 1, go back to the UPM and upload a new copy of the .OBR (without explicitly re-enabling the plugin).
# On nodes 1 and 2, refresh the pages again. Notice that the Gliffy links appear on one node indicating that it is enabled, but those links are not visible on the other node. Additionally, Gliffy shows as enabled in the UPM for one node but disabled on the other.

h3. Expected Results
Plugin is enabled in both nodes

h3. Actual Results
One of the nodes shows it as enabled, while the other does not

h3.Workaround
* Enable the plugin in the node where it appears as disabled. 
or
* [Clear the plugin cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+clear+Confluence+plugins+cache] and restart both nodes.
fields.summary: Re-installing plugin while disabled in Data Center causes inconsistent UPM state

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45387].
  {panel}

Current behavior in Confluence:

If a local group (for example, confluence-users) exists in external directory and that directory is being connected to Confluence as Read Only with Local Groups, this will results with users are unable to be assigned the confluence-users group from UI side.

This is because Confluence has marked this group as 'not local' from the database side. Therefore, group membership unable to be altered, as the connection is essentially "read only".

It'll be great if Confluence able to detect that these groups exists locally, and therefore marked this group as "local" groups. 

Reason: "confluence-users" group could be added in AD side and therefore blocks administrator to assign group memberships
fields.summary: Be able to detect "Local" groups in Confluence, even though the same group exists externally

h3. Summary
When an user tries to like a page, using the Like link provided in the notification email of any kind of action, they get a 403 permission denied error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # The link will bring us to the corresponding page and should do the required action.

h3. Actual Results
Upon clicking like" or "Disable weekly summary" or "Switch to Daily summary" links from an email notification throws 403 error:

The following appears in the atlassian-confluence.log
{code:java|title=atlassian-confluence.log}
2016-10-21 02:04:24,928 WARN [http-nio-8080-exec-13] [com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation] executeResult No result defined for action com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.like.actions.LikeAction and result input

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45382].
  {panel}

Since the introduction of the new preview feature in Confluence users are complaining about not being able to search within the shown/previewed document. They are used to this feature from all other PDF viewers (Adobe, Chrome etc.).

This is especially important as it is not that easy for the unexperienced user anymore to download the PDF and open it with their preferred viewer.

We've already discussed this feature request with Wendell K. in an enterprise customer interview back in June.

Btw. the implicit user expectation is that the same inline document search works for MSWord/PowerPoint/Excel previews as well.
fields.summary: PDF Preview should have inline document search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45381].
  {panel}

We're trying to deploy Confluence by automating the installation. We need a way to script the entire process from scratch all the way up to a working and fully configured Confluence instance. I'm using Ansible for this task, but the same problem exists for all similar tools (Puppet, Chef, Salt, etc).

The *installation* can be done programmatically. But the *setup* part involves clicking through a wizard web interface to select the installation type, put in the license, configure the database, etc: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-setup-guide-135691.html.
This prevents proper automation.

I know that Stash exposes a REST API that can be used to automate some of these steps (for instance the license: https://developer.atlassian.com/static/rest/stash/3.11.3/stash-rest.html#idp1739392), but the Confluence REST API doesn't expose anything like this.

So at this point our devops process is stuck and we need to manually click through a wizard, which is a real pain.

Confluence needs to be able to get deployed without manual intervention.

This can either be done by providing options during install, for instance using a simple configuration file with license, install type, plugins to include.

Or extend the REST API to handle these.
fields.summary: Automated deployment

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The Workbox method {{setPingCompleted}} is susceptible to creating deadlock scenarios, which may lead to an instance running into OOME.

# Two threads run {{setPingCompleted}} at the exact same time
# One thread completes, while the other remains stuck with a database lock.
# The thread cannot be finalized, and other objects using the database will be unable to be finalized as well
# Eventually the instance will run out of database connections or generate an OOME

h2. Evidence in thread dumps
Example thread:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-8000-exec-15" #55708 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007fca6801c800 nid=0x48e3 runnable [0x00007fc994e5c000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:170)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
	at java.io.DataInputStream.readFully(DataInputStream.java:195)
	at java.io.DataInputStream.readFully(DataInputStream.java:169)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SharedSocket.readPacket(SharedSocket.java:841)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SharedSocket.getNetPacket(SharedSocket.java:722)
	- locked <0x00000004056a3120> (a java.util.ArrayList)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ResponseStream.getPacket(ResponseStream.java:466)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ResponseStream.read(ResponseStream.java:103)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ResponseStream.peek(ResponseStream.java:88)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.wait(TdsCore.java:3928)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.executeSQL(TdsCore.java:1045)
	- locked <0x00000004056a3138> (a net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQL(JtdsStatement.java:537)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(JtdsPreparedStatement.java:505)
	- locked <0x00000004056a3198> (a net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ConnectionJDBC3)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:97)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:97)
	at net.java.ao.DatabaseProvider.executeInsertReturningKey(DatabaseProvider.java:1955)
	at net.java.ao.db.SQLServerDatabaseProvider.insertReturningKey(SQLServerDatabaseProvider.java:358)
	- locked <0x000000035422b560> (a net.java.ao.db.SQLServerDatabaseProvider)
	at net.java.ao.EntityManager.create(EntityManager.java:366)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.create(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects.create(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:261)
	...
	at com.atlassian.mywork.host.dao.ao.AOUserApplicationLinkDao.setPingCompleted(AOUserApplicationLinkDao.java:29)
{code}

Key line to look for:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
	at com.atlassian.mywork.host.dao.ao.AOUserApplicationLinkDao.setPingCompleted(AOUserApplicationLinkDao.java:29)
{code}

h2. How to reproduce
# Install Confluence with MSSQL database
# Link Confluence and Jira (Confluence should manage its users)
# Create user "user1" in both systems
# Create Jira ticket and assign it to user1
# Create a page in Confluence and insert link to the Jira ticket
# Login to Confluence as user1 and go to the page with the Jira link
# Authorise access to Jira to view Jira ticket's info
# Insert a lot of records (millions) to AO_USER table and limit CPU and IO resources for database, so it should become slow
# Open Confluence in two browsers (logged as user1) and click to the "notifications" icon in both browsers (at the same time)
One thread will be waiting for DB answer (DB is trying to insert record to AO_USER), another thread will be trying to enter to synchronised block -> deadlock.

h2. Workaround
Disable the Workbox plugins:
# !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/590259974/Cog.png! > *Add-ons*
# Change the dropdown from *User-installed* to *System*
# Locate and *Disable* these three plugins:
#* Workbox - Common Plugin
#* Workbox - Confluence Provider Plugin
#* Workbox - Host Plugin

h2. Resolution
SQLServerDatabaseProvider.insertReturningKey in AO library mustn't be synchronized because it produce deadlocks in MSSQL databases
fields.summary: The Workbox's setPingCompleted method is susceptible to deadlocks

fields.description:
Each jar file occupies around 60MB of disk space. Multiple jar files will occupy a considerable space until the temp directory is cleaned up.
The synchrony-standalone jar must be named in a consistent way, for example: synchrony-standalone-6.1.0.jar
fields.summary: A new synchrony-standalone jar temp file should not be generated every time Confluence is restarted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Popular Content macro, if an invalid space name is given, the macro will instead pull popular content globally. This causes high load on the server and long running HTTP requests as it is resolving page permissions. In large instances, this large request can cause Confluence to crash, especially if the page is loaded multiple times.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable *Confluence Usage Stats* macro
# Browse to a page and insert the {{popular content}} macro
# Edit the macro settings
# Set the *Restrict to these Spaces* option to a false space name

h3. Expected Results
# It does not allow you to save these settings

h3. Actual Results
# It allows you to save the text, regardless of whether it maps to a space
# When you load the page, it loads the tally of Popular Content for all content, globally
# For large instances this can lead to long running requests that lead to:
## The page not loading
## The Confluence instance going down

h3. Suggested Resolution
# Restrict Confluence to only allow entering valid space names
# Or if the incorrect space is entered, it should only search the current space - which is the current default behavior if you leave the field blank.

h3.Workaround
Access the page as a system admin, via the editpage URL <base_URL>/pages/editpage.action?pageId=<page_id> and remove the macro.
fields.summary: Popular Content macro does not restrict the space parameter to existing spaces and pulls site wide info leading to the page to hanging and crashes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The content of Page Properties macro is available from the search even if it's hidden (with Hidden property)  on the page if the user has View permissions on space or "Read Only" restriction for the page.
The issue is reproducible with anonymous access as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create space
# Assign View permission on this space to one of the groups
# Create a page in that space and add Page Properties macro with hidden attribute
# Search for the word used as an attribute or as as value in Page Properties macro

h3. Expected Results
The text from hidden Page Properties macro is available in search only for the users with Edit permissions
h3. Actual Results
The hidden text is available in search results for all users with View permissions
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround currently avaialble.
fields.summary: Hidden content of Page Properties macro is available in search when you user have read permissions

fields.description:
h3.Step to reproduce
# Install Confluence 6.0.1 and create a new page.
# Navigate to {{Profile > Settings}} and click on 'Edit'.
# Change the language to English (US) and click on 'Submit'.
# Edit the page created in step #1 above.
# Hover over the "Update" button.

h3. Expected results
!Update button - expected results.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
 !Update button - actual results.png|thumbnail!  

As you can see, the tooltip message is changed from {{Update published page (⌘S)}} to {{Update published page (Type '⌘S')}}.
fields.summary: Modifying the language in the user profile settings changes the page's 'Update' button tooltip message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45347].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
No way currently to embed .mpp file other than linking to it
This doesn't permit the user to view the file in Confluence, only once downloaded.
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to embed in Confluence or preview

h3. Why this is important
So users can view the Gantt charts, etc. created in Microsoft Project
 
h3. Workaround 
Convert the .mpp file to something such as an image screenshot or PDF and embed that.
fields.summary: Ability to embed MS Project Files
Provide configurable HTTP header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45345].
  {panel}

We just upgraded from 6.4.11 to 7.2.5 and when using the time tracking theres a new link at the bottom of the page saying *"Find more time-tracking add-ons"*.

I disabled the feature* "Allow users to request add-ons"* and I somehow hoped that this would hide this link but didn't.

 

*Suggestions:*

1.) *remove* the link "Find more time-tracking add-ons"2.) *connect the visibility* of "Find more time-tracking add-ons" with that flag "Allow users to request add-ons"

IMHO this link is an ad to buy more stuff and should be optional.
fields.summary: Hide or remove "Find more time-tracking add-ons"

fields.description:
{panel:title=UPDATE as of 29 May, 2017|titleBGColor=#ccd9ea}
This issue only happened in Confluence 6.0.1 because Confluence failed to route Synchrony requests to its built-in proxy when SSL is configured in Tomcat. The problem has been fixed since Confluence 6.0.2 (with this ticket: [CONFSERVER-45273|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45273]) and above. In Confluence 6.1+, the built-in proxy is properly utilised when Confluence detects that SSL is terminated at Tomcat. I will close this ticket to avoid any confusion.
{panel}
h5. Example configuration:
 * No Proxy. Just SSL
 * Sample confluence URL: {{[https://mycompany.com:8016|https://mycompany.com:8016/]}}
 * reza.port=8017
 * synchrony.port=8017

{code:java|title=Server.xml}
<Server port="8000" shutdown="SHUTDOWN">
    <Service name="Tomcat-Standalone">
        <Connector port="8015" connectionTimeout="20000" redirectPort="8443"
                maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
                enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
                protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol" />

        <Engine name="Standalone" defaultHost="localhost">
            <Host name="localhost" appBase="webapps" unpackWARs="true" autoDeploy="false">
                <Context path="" docBase="../confluence" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
                    <Manager pathname="" />
                    <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve" threshold="60" />
                </Context>
            </Host>
        </Engine>

	<Connector
           protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"
           port="8443" maxThreads="200" minSpareThreads="25" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
           enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
           acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true" SSLEnabled="true"
           keystoreFile="<path-to-keystore-file>/keystore.jks" keystorePass="password"
           clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS"/>
    </Service>
</Server>
{code}
Registered JVM Arguments in the application.xml:
{code:java|title=Application.xml}
    <virtual-machine-arguments>-Dcatalina.base=<Confluence Service Location> -Dcatalina.home=<Confluence Service Location> -Djava.endorsed.dirs=<Confluence Service Location>\endorsed -Djava.io.tmpdir=<Confluence Service Location>\temp -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Djava.util.logging.config.file=<Confluence Service Location>\conf\logging.properties -Dreza.port=8017 -Dsynchrony.port=8017 -Dhttps.proxyHost=mycompany.com -Dhttps.proxyPort=8016 exit -Xms512m -Xmx2048m</virtual-machine-arguments>
{code}
h5. other notes
 * Connector ports used for HTTP and HTTPS are 8015 and 8443 but we're accessing Confluence via HTTPS and port 8016
 * Address {{mycompany.com}} is currently a redirection from the public gateway to the internal confluence machine, using *DNAT portforwarding*
 * If we access Confluence using HTTP and port 8015: {{[http://mycompany.com:8015|http://mycompany.com:8015/]}} synchrony is working

h5. Observation:

Confluence is *accessible* in HTTPS and port 8016, :{{[https://mycompany.com:8016|https://mycompany.com:8016/]}} while *Synchrony is not*. We keep seeing this error:
{code:java|title=atlassian-confluence.log}
2016-11-18 10:18:26,804 DEBUG [ListenableFutureAdapter-thread-3] [plugins.synchrony.utils.SynchronyProxyUtil] isSynchronyProxyRunning {}
 -- url: /rest/synchrony-interop/enable | referer: https://mycompany.com:8016/admin/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin/configure.action | traceId: d2d97f26a2exxxxx | userName: admin
org.apache.http.conn.HttpHostConnectException: Connect to mycompany.com:8016 [mycompany.com/192.168.x.x] failed: Connection refused: connect
        ...
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.utils.SynchronyProxyUtil.isSynchronyProxyRunning(SynchronyProxyUtil.java:41)
{code}
fields.summary: Collaborative editing does not work when Confluence is running with SSL configured in Tomcat and behind a firewall with DNAT port forwarding

h3. Summary
A warning message is shown when the user is not able to add an incline comment. However, confluence did not specific the reason why user not able to add an inline comment. This will make user confuse on when an inline comment is able to add and when is not able to add.

h3. Suggestion
Provide proper warning message to the user on why an inline comment is not able to add.
fields.summary: Improve the warning message display to user when an inline comment are not addable
